google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi, I'm sorry you are not enjoying Lemuroid. Please check out the wiki for scanning issues https://github.com/Swordfish90/Lemuroid/wiki/Scanning . If you are still having issues please send me an email with more details such as which systems are you using and which games. Also keep in mind that psx games are only support in iso and pbp format now.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Lisa. I see you're playing on a Chromebook. I'm sorry, but currently keyboard is not supported. I'm sure this will eventually come in a future update, but if you want to play now you need to connect a gamepad (or use the touch controls).

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Robert, you can already import sav files from other emulators. It's still a bit inconvenient though, you need to copy them into the Lemuroid saves directory with the name "gamename.srm", you can find more info about this in the wiki: https://github.com/Swordfish90/Lemuroid/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions

Great app! Unfortunately, with the last Samsung Update One UI3.1, Android 11. The buttons are not working, you have to press in a random place over the screen to push them. This makes the emulator not able for use. Hopes it gets fixed soon or is there a callibration method?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi James, sadly I'm aware of the issue. It's a regression introduced by Samsung with Android 11: https://github.com/Swordfish90/Lemuroid/issues/178 . The workaround I suggest at the moment is to disable "Game Mode" for Lemuroid, or simply disable "Resolution Scaling", you can find more extensive details at the link I posted.

Great on paper but there are a few breaks in execution. 1. There are frequent inconsistencies in library scanning. For instance, on my first scan it picked up all 3 snes titles but none of the 4 nes titles. After choosing the factory reset option and scanning the same directories, the opposite happened. 2. There is no way to set tiling options. You just get one long horizontal list of your games. Lastly, the app looks great, not overloaded with too many settings. Controls are good.

However, last night I went on to install it on my Galaxy Tab S7...when i went to choose my directory a few hours ago, it crashes almost immediately & doesn't open the finder & when it was functioning, it took over an hour to scan the same small roms that took my phone less than 2 minutes to to scan fully. Please, take this issue/bug into consideration...Thank You.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Salah, I'm sorry you're experiencing issues with Lemuroid. The Galaxy Tab S7 should be plenty powerful to handle Lemuroid so I'll investigate this. Is there any other difference between the two devices? (ROMs on internal/external sdcard, GDrive save sync active). Are you able to reproduce the crashes even with simples cores (GB, NES)?

This is an impressive multi-emulator with a nice UI. However, a few things hold it back. The lack of virtual pad customization is made even worse with the strange layouts for systems with a lot of buttons such as the Genesid and N64 And don't even bother with N64, there are so many graphical errors that it's not even worth playing. If you plan on using a bluetooth controller and not playing N64, go for it. Otherwise, I can't truly recommend it, but perhaps it will improve with future updates.
